headline: Is VICI Properties (VICI) Offering Value After Recent Steady Share Price Performance
summary: If you are wondering whether VICI Properties is offering good value at its recent price, you are not alone. This article is designed to help you frame that question clearly. The stock last closed at US$29.17, with returns of 1.1% over 7 days, 4.6% over 30 days, 3.6% year to date, 3.6% over 1 year and 38.6% over 5 years. Recent coverage around VICI has focused on its position as a large owner of experiential real estate and its role in the U.S. gaming and hospitality sector. This helps...

headline: How Recent Analyst Shifts Are Rewriting The Story For VICI Properties (VICI)
summary: Why VICI’s Price Target Just Got a Subtle Reset The updated fair value estimate for VICI Properties has been trimmed from about US$35.39 to roughly US$35.13, a small reset that reflects both cautious and constructive views now incorporated into the model. This shift aligns with analysts who see room for VICI to execute on its existing leases and development projects, while more cautious perspectives highlight muted gaming investment opportunities and tenant specific concerns that justify a...

headline: VICI Properties Expands With Las Vegas Locals Casinos As Risks Reassessed
summary: VICI Properties (NYSE:VICI) is entering the Las Vegas Locals market through the acquisition of seven casino properties. The deal adds a new regional gaming cluster to VICI’s portfolio of experiential real estate assets. Following the announcement, analysts have updated their views, including a downgrade from Scotiabank citing evolving lease risks, while others maintain a positive stance. VICI Properties focuses on owning gaming, hospitality, and entertainment real estate and leasing it to...

headline: VICI Properties Vs. Gaming and Leisure Properties: The Vegas-Focused REIT Is The Winner
summary: VICI Properties and Gaming and Leisure Properties are two casino REITs that look similar on the surface. But read why our choice is VICI in the casino sector.
